Description: A hollow terracotta figure of a cat standing with its head turned to its left; the tail curls round the left hind leg. It wears a garland round its neck, together with an amulet on a ribbon; a strap passes round the body just behind the front legs. The rear has summary detail. A small firing-vent is pierced below the belly near hind legs. Two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt, brown on the surface. Traces of an overall white dressing. Red paint inside ears and on mouth.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. Roman, first to second century AD.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3714)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
